entry_level.description: This roadmap is shared across all entry-level SOC Analyst timelines (ASAP, 6 Months, 1 Year, Flexible). The only difference is in the suggested duration per module.

checklist.task: Watch SOC analyst workflow videos
Complete visual SIEM demonstration series
View incident response case study videos
Watch threat hunting demonstration videos
Complete interactive SOC simulations
View security tools overview videos
Install and explore Splunk Enterprise
Complete Splunk Fundamentals 1
Watch dashboard/correlation rule demos
Build SPL queries with real data (Boss of the SOC)
Deploy ELK stack

resources.name: Elastic
resources.note: Elastic Cloud free trial or self-hosted

checklist.task: Configure Filebeat, Logstash, Kibana dashboards
Create alerting with ElastAlert or Kibana tools

network_security.description: Network analysis and packet inspection techniques

checklist.task: Watch TCP/IP and network protocol breakdown videos
Complete Wireshark walkthroughs
Analyze malware PCAP files
Configure Suricata/Snort in lab
Build network detection rules

incident_response.description: Incident handling and forensic investigation techniques

checklist.task: Watch IR lifecycle explanation videos
Perform sandbox malware analysis
Use Autopsy and Volatility for forensic review
Practice evidence handling, reporting
Develop basic IR playbooks

advanced_detection.description: Advanced threat detection and hunting techniques

checklist.task: Deploy Sysmon in test VMs
Create detection rules mapped to MITRE TTPs
Use Sigma, YARA for detection
Run threat hunting hypothesis labs
Automate responses with simple scripts

security_operations_reading.description: Essential reading materials for security operations

checklist.task: Read NIST incident handling framework
Study SOC design principles
Review detection engineering guides
Combine reading with explainer videos

timeline_options.name: ASAP (Intensive)
timeline_options.description: Fast-paced intensive learning path for those who can dedicate full-time hours

timeline_options.name: 6 Months
timeline_options.description: Balanced pace for working professionals with moderate weekly availability

timeline_options.name: 1 Year
timeline_options.description: Slower pace for those with limited weekly study time

timeline_options.name: Flexible
timeline_options.description: Customizable timeline, recommended completion within 6-12 months
timeline_options.recommendation: Adjust based on personal availability and learning speed

hands_on_labs.name: TryHackMe – Blue Team Labs
hands_on_labs.description: Interactive blue team training rooms including SIEM and threat hunting exercises

hands_on_labs.name: PacketLife Labs – PCAP analysis
hands_on_labs.description: Practical packet capture analysis exercises with malware PCAPs

hands_on_labs.name: Blue Team Labs Online
hands_on_labs.description: Incident response simulations and forensic challenges

hands_on_labs.name: Wireshark Lab Exercises
hands_on_labs.description: Protocol analysis and network traffic inspection exercises

certifications.name: TryHackMe Blue Team Path Certificate
certifications.description: Completion of core Blue Team rooms

certifications.name: CompTIA CySA+
certifications.description: Optional for stronger Incident Response skills

mid_level.description: This roadmap builds upon the entry-level foundation and targets analysts with 1–2 years of experience. The goal is to transition from alert triage and response to deeper investigation, proactive threat hunting, detection engineering, and coordination during incidents.

advanced_siem_and_detection_engineering.description: Advanced practices in detection engineering using SIEM tools and frameworks.

checklist.task: Complete Splunk Power User (free prep via Splunk docs)
Tune existing detection rules for noise reduction
Build advanced SPL/KQL queries to detect tactics and behaviors
Write Sigma rules mapped to MITRE techniques
Create dashboards and correlation rules with multi-source logs
Use ATT&CK Navigator to assess and close detection gaps

threat_hunting_and_log_analysis.description: Proactive hunting using MITRE-based hypothesis and log analysis.

checklist.task: Run hypothesis-based hunts using MITRE framework
Collect and analyze Sysmon/EDR/Windows logs
Hunt for lateral movement (e.g., RDP, WMI, PsExec usage)
Identify anomalies in DNS, proxy, and endpoint behavior
Document threat hunt reports with findings and remediation

incident_response_advanced.description: In-depth IR with leadership, memory analysis, and forensic timelines.

checklist.task: Lead containment and remediation steps for malware outbreaks
Perform live triage on Windows endpoints
Use Volatility3 for memory analysis
Run forensic timelines and identify persistence mechanisms
Write IR summary and lessons learned reports

endpoint_detection_and_host_forensics.description: Deep dive into EDR telemetry, IOC creation, and host-based artifacts.

checklist.task: Interpret behavioral detections (process injection, LOLBins)
Capture and analyze EDR telemetry (process tree, registry changes)
Create endpoint queries to find IOCs and malicious artifacts
Integrate EDR telemetry with SIEM for detection enhancement

security_orchestration_and_automation.description: Automate SOC operations using SOAR platforms and scripting.

checklist.task: Build playbooks for alert triage and automated response
Automate IOC enrichment using public APIs (VirusTotal, AbuseIPDB)
Develop scripts for repetitive SOC tasks (log parsing, file hash checks)
Use Jupyter Notebooks for investigation workflows

security_operations_documentation_and_in.description: Enhancing SOC maturity with structured documentation and threat intelligence integration.

checklist.task: Read NIST guidance on incident handling
Document detection logic and playbooks clearly for SOC use
Integrate threat intelligence feeds into workflows
Use MISP to manage and share IOCs internally
Create threat reports with context-rich IOC analysis

timeline_options.name: ASAP (Intensive)
timeline_options.description: Ideal for full-time learners or those with time off from work. Expect rapid progression and deep immersion.

timeline_options.name: 6 Months
timeline_options.description: Balanced pace for working professionals with moderate availability.

timeline_options.name: 1 Year
timeline_options.description: Low-intensity option for professionals learning in evenings or weekends.

timeline_options.name: Flexible
timeline_options.description: Choose your own pace based on life schedule. Regular progress checks recommended.

hands_on_labs.name: TryHackMe – Threat Hunting & Blue Team Rooms
hands_on_labs.description: Hands-on blue team labs covering threat hunting, SIEM analysis, and incident response scenarios.

hands_on_labs.name: CyberDefenders Challenges
hands_on_labs.description: Free challenges for practicing digital forensics, detection engineering, and log analysis.

hands_on_labs.name: Blue Team Labs Online – Complex Incident Simulations
hands_on_labs.description: Pro-tier labs that simulate full-scope security incidents with live systems and tools.

hands_on_labs.name: Velociraptor Sandboxes
hands_on_labs.description: Use Velociraptor to collect, analyze, and hunt across endpoints using real-world telemetry.

certifications.name: Splunk Core Certified Power User
certifications.description: Advanced Splunk certification focusing on searching, reporting, and knowledge objects.

certifications.name: CompTIA CySA+
certifications.description: Intermediate-level certification for cybersecurity analysts focused on threat detection and response.

certifications.name: Microsoft SC-200: Security Operations Analyst Associate
certifications.description: Certification focusing on threat detection, response, and incident handling in Microsoft cloud environments.

certifications.name: TryHackMe Threat Hunter Certificate
certifications.description: Earned after completing threat hunting rooms in the Blue Team Path on TryHackMe.

certifications.name: GIAC Certified Intrusion Analyst (GCIA)
certifications.description: Advanced SANS certification focused on network traffic analysis and intrusion detection.

certifications.name: GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH)
certifications.description: Focuses on incident handling, attacker techniques, and defense strategies.

senior_level.description: This roadmap builds on mid-level experience and prepares professionals to lead detection strategy, coordinate incident response, optimize SOC tooling, manage teams, and align with business and risk goals.

strategic_soc_leadership_and_operations.description: Lead SOC with maturity models, metrics, escalation, and management strategies.

checklist.task: Study NIST CSF, SOC-CMM maturity model
Define SOC metrics: MTTD, MTTR, alert fidelity, SLA
Create leadership dashboards for CISO-level reporting
Build and manage SOC shift coverage and escalation models
Understand MSSP integration vs internal team maturity models

detection_engineering_and_mitre_coverage.description: Map and tune detection logic using ATT&CK and Sigma, with version control.

checklist.task: Build and refine detection logic aligned with ATT&CK TTPs
Map existing detection coverage using ATT&CK Navigator
Write and test Sigma rules (convert to SPL/KQL where needed)
Reduce false positives via rule tuning, feedback loops
Maintain detection-as-code repository (version control)

advanced_incident_handling_and_response_.description: Lead major IR operations, build playbooks, run tabletop exercises, and post-incident reporting.

checklist.task: Lead major incident coordination (ransomware, C2 beaconing)
Build and test IR playbooks across multiple attack vectors
Run tabletop exercises and purple team simulations
Analyze root cause and produce executive post-mortems
Work with legal/compliance for breach reporting and evidence handling

security_tooling_architecture_and_automa.description: Architect and automate SOC tools, alert workflows, and log pipelines.

checklist.task: Manage SIEM performance, ingestion pipelines, alert fidelity
Evaluate tooling gaps: EDR, proxy, identity, DNS, network
Automate alert enrichment and response workflows (SOAR)
Integrate threat intel feeds (MISP, AbuseIPDB, OpenCTI)
Build API scripts for custom log collectors and IOC triage

team_management_and_analyst_development.description: Manage and grow SOC teams through feedback, skill paths, and leadership best practices.

checklist.task: Conduct regular performance reviews and feedback loops
Build tiered analyst skill development paths (L1–L3)
Run SOC onboarding and skill-building labs
Manage burnout, retention, and shift morale
Develop cross-team relationships (IR, DevSecOps, Threat Intel)

security_governance_and_risk_alignment.description: Align SOC operations with business risk, compliance, audits, and governance frameworks.

checklist.task: Translate technical incidents into business impact for leadership
Develop executive reporting on threat trends, SOC KPIs
Participate in risk committees, compliance reviews
Align detection priorities with business risk profiles
Track audit requirements and tooling readiness

timeline_options.name: ASAP (Intensive)
timeline_options.description: Immersive timeline designed for professionals seeking rapid readiness for senior SOC or management roles.

timeline_options.name: 6 Months
timeline_options.description: Balanced timeline for working professionals aiming to develop leadership and advanced detection skills.

timeline_options.name: 1 Year
timeline_options.description: Longer timeline suited for professionals with limited time availability or concurrent responsibilities.

timeline_options.name: Flexible
timeline_options.description: Ideal for learners who prefer to set their own pace while targeting career growth into SOC management.

hands_on_labs.name: TryHackMe – Threat Hunting & Blue Team Pro Labs
hands_on_labs.description: Interactive blue team labs covering threat hunting, incident response, and real-world detection use cases.

hands_on_labs.name: Blue Team Labs Online – Simulated IR Scenarios
hands_on_labs.description: Hands-on labs simulating advanced incident response and detection scenarios, including APT and ransomware.
hands_on_labs.cost: Free tier with paid Pro labs

hands_on_labs.name: Splunk Attack Range
hands_on_labs.description: Deployable lab environment to simulate attacks and test SIEM detection logic using Splunk.

hands_on_labs.name: CyberDefenders Challenges
hands_on_labs.description: Free challenges covering forensics, memory analysis, and log-based threat detection.

hands_on_labs.name: MITRE ATT&CK Workbench
hands_on_labs.description: Create, manage, and visualize custom adversary behavior mappings for detection strategy planning.

certifications.name: CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional)
certifications.description: Comprehensive certification for senior security professionals focusing on governance, risk, and leadership.

certifications.name: Blue Team Level 2 – Security Blue Team
certifications.description: Operational certification covering advanced detection engineering, threat hunting, and response strategy.

certifications.name: Certified SOC Operations Manager (CSOM)
certifications.description: Focuses on SOC leadership, process maturity, KPIs, and team development.

certifications.name: MITRE ATT&CK Defender (MAD)
certifications.description: Hands-on certification focused on applying the MITRE ATT&CK framework for detection and defense.

certifications.name: Splunk Enterprise Security Certified Admin
certifications.description: Advanced certification for configuring, managing, and optimizing Splunk ES in a security operations context.
